total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern of the number 2 in the input grid. It seems to form a specific shape or pattern.
Q2: Identify the pattern of the number 3 in the input grid. It seems to form a specific shape or pattern.
Q3: Identify the relationship between the patterns of the number 2 and the number 3 in the input grid.
Q4: Identify the changes from the input grid to the output grid in the examples. It seems that some of the 2s are changed to 8s.
Q5: Identify the rule for changing 2s to 8s. It seems to be related to the pattern of the number 2 and the number 3 in the input grid.
Q6: Apply the rule identified in Q5 to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grid. The pattern seems to be a 2x2 square of 2s, with the top left corner being replaced by an 8 in the output grid.
Q2: Identify the locations of these 2x2 squares in the input grid.
Q3: Replace the top left corner of each 2x2 square with an 8 in the output grid.
Q4: Identify any other changes between the input and output grids. In this case, it seems that rows filled with 3s in the input grid are replaced with rows filled with 0s in the output grid.
Q5: Replace rows filled with 3s in the input grid with rows filled with 0s in the output grid.
